text:
.@washingtonpost⁩ is correct that additional $322B for #PPP will run out
But wrong on two points:
1.PPP doesn’t impose“due diligence requirements”for banks,that’s existing law
2.Requirement of 75% on payroll is a regulation decision,it’s not in the bill https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/small-businesses-needed-this-second-round-of-loans-but-they-wont-be-enough/2020/04/26/b081feda-8640-11ea-a3eb-e9fc93160703_story.html

As we deal with this crisis, we need to envision a new America, where health care, housing, decent-paying jobs and dignified retirement are human rights. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1254547423906709506/img/XQbpxF45p68aR1tr.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1254547423906709506/vid/320x320/X_tb15gKtqPQ6RhR.mp4?tag=13

Trump rejected coronavirus information from the American intelligence community.
He minimized the seriousness of this crisis.
He muzzled public health experts.

At a time when Americans are depending on competent leadership, he has failed again and again.

This is ridiculous. USPS workers and the countless people who rely on the USPS for their small business, prescription drugs, as well as casting their ballot deserve better. 

Congress must immediately step in to ensure the USPS can continue delivering the mail. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1253735596956188675 QT @washingtonpost Trump says he will block emergency coronavirus aid for U.S. Postal Service if it doesn’t hike prices immediately https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2020/04/24/trump-postal-service-loan-treasury/

Am so very sorry to hear this. All three of us spent a lot of time together on the road & and I always appreciated Willie’s easy smile and joyful spirit. May God’s peace and comfort be with his family and loved ones. RIP. https://twitter.com/tomabrahams13/status/1254443901504675842 QT @TomAbrahams13 Willie Dixon was singular. He was a bright light. He was a beautiful soul. He was a devoted husband and proud loving father. He was a talented, smart, tireless journalist who always saw the best in people. He was kind and genuine. And he was my friend. 🎥🎥 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EWiuFDQXsAEaFye.jpg

Our EMTs walk directly into the face of danger every single day. There's no way we could possibly repay them for their incredible sacrifice. We couldn't make it through this without them.

#PPP restarts tomorrow at 10:30EST

This is good news because this additional $322B will help countless #SmallBusinesses & will save millions of jobs 

The $672B committed to #PPP is an extraordinary amount,but the hard truth is that the extraordinary demand is even higher

If the Postal Service goes under, universal and affordable delivery would no longer be a guaranteed public service.

That's unacceptable.

During this emergency, the Postal Service is needed now more than ever.

Congress must take immediate action to protect USPS.

People across America are going hungry because of the ongoing pandemic. Ensuring that children, the elderly and people with disabilities are fed must be a priority in Congress.
 
My new bill will expand SNAP benefits to ensure people can afford to eat. https://www.motherjones.com/coronavirus-updates/2020/04/too-many-people-are-going-hungry-right-now-harris-gillibrand-and-sanders-are-offering-a-lifeline/

2/x And too many who love Trump are too quick to dismiss the pandemic as purely media-driven (“hydroxychloroquine will cure it’s all!”) & say everyone must go back to work NOW. If we are being fair & reasonable, NEITHER view makes much sense.  Trump didn’t create this virus....

I applaud towns and school districts who are stepping up to ensure that students and adults in their communities have access to the internet. With three million students lacking basic internet access, investing in affordable broadband services is more important than ever before. https://twitter.com/npr/status/1253821196732444673 QT @NPR With help from a local Internet provider, this rural Texas school district is installing booster towers that will beam the Internet into every home that needs it — free of charge.

It will cost the district just $30 a year per household. https://www.npr.org/2020/04/24/843411430/even-in-crisis-times-there-is-a-push-to-wire-rural-america?utm_campaign=npr&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_term=nprnews

I’m focused not only on the present coronavirus situation but also on the future. When there is a vaccine we need to be prepared to ensure equal access for all—not just the wealthy or well-connected. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EWkyPvfWoAMUHuv.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1254588959495196672/vid/480x270/Us2khN-r_KtFZTdf.mp4?tag=13

The president is asking you to inject Lysol into your lungs. Please don’t do this or drink bleach. https://twitter.com/cnnsotu/status/1254410225446240256 QT @CNNSotu "Disinfectant in the body — you know what they call that? They call that embalming, that's the medical term." @SpeakerPelosi on President Trump's request to look into the possibility of injecting disinfectant as a treatment for the coronavirus #CNNSOTU http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1254410080008785920/img/08qP6KZxXFuvTjjH.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1254410080008785920/vid/480x270/kP_OWMQX3VBvP8JO.mp4?tag=13

4/x “The second phone call, on March 10, was a formal and final warning. The powerful person called Teng to his office and told him the event would embarrass the University and potentially threaten the continuation of collaborative programs and joint research with China.”

6/x “Though the Harvard-China relationship always entailed mutual benefit, it was for decades asymmetrical — China needed Harvard more than Harvard needed China, which perhaps gave the University more leeway to be critical of the Chinese government.”

4/x Our goal should be protecting as many lives as possible, both from COVID-19 AND from crushing poverty & unemployment. We should value lives on both sides on the ledger, and not let angry partisan politics drive our responses to this crisis.

I keep the LORD always before me;with him at my right hand, I shall never be shaken.

Psalms 16:6

7/x “But over the past decade, China’s global influence has grown dramatically. In 2010, China became the world’s second-largest economy; in 2018, it surpassed the U.S. in terms of scientific papers published. Escalating tensions have accompanied this shift in global power....”

What we must guarantee to Americans during this crisis:

✅Every worker continues to receive their paycheck
✅Everyone has the health care they need without out-of-pocket expenses
✅Every adult receives $2,000 a month
